intro: Callistephana varia, commonly known as the variable callistephana, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Proteaceae family, which includes many ornamental and ecologically significant plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
